data.title: [json] Extra quotes get added when trying to add a closing quote in json file
data.body:
In a json file
- add double quotes, closing quotes get added
- delete the closing quotes
- add the closing quote yourself

Observe that another double quotes get added.

Repros without any extensions as well

![jsonquotes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16890566/28935957-fce73144-783a-11e7-9809-283b9d2fda1f.gif)

data.title: Terminal quits if app termination is started but not finished

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e)
- OS Version: macOS Siera (10.12.6)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode and open integrated terminal
2. Make changes to some file
3. Invoke VSCode shutdown (e.g. via clicking `x` button)
3. When prompted with question if you want to save file content click `Cancel`
4. I expected everything to continue working, but terminal was terminated
5. After closing it and opening it again it did start and was functional, but selection of text in terminal is not possible.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: VS Code\PowerShell - "Formatting Document" Long Execution Time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
azuretoolsforvscode|bra|1.2.9
azure-iot-toolkit|for|0.1.3
azure-functions-tools|joh|0.3.0
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
vscode-azureextensionpack|ms-|0.0.4
azurerm-vscode-tools|msa|0.3.6
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
easy-snippet-maker|tar|0.0.6
usql-vscode-ext|usq|0.2.4



---

Hello!
I've noticed over the last couple days/week that VS Code is taking a very long time on "Formatting Document". I have my VS Code instance configured to format the document on every save, and I save constantly, so this is a real PITA. :( I have attached the contents of $env:APPDATA\Code\User to this report. 
[v-toddle@microsoft.com.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1197772/v-toddle.microsoft.com.zip)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure VS Code using my settings.json
2. Open up any Posh Script. I have encountered this on scripts with as few as 120 lines
3. Make a change
4. Save file
5. Blue bar at bottom of VS Code states "Formatting Document". VS Code is responsive, but Snippets and Intellisense do not function until it completes doing whatever it was doing.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Changing between "find" and "replace" in regex mode corrupts state of find widget
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-28-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
xml|Dot|1.9.2
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.8.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.2
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
Angular2|joh|2.4.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
vetur|oct|0.9.3
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0



---

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. CTRL+F to show find widget, set Regex mode
1. Type a simple regular expression that matches some text in your document.  Make some minor changes by typing part of the expression, deleting with backspace, maybe move around the text field with the arrow keys.
1. CTRL+Z / CTRL+Y several times to undo/redo typing the expression.  Redo until the expression is complete, and ensure that some text in your document matches and gets highlighted.
1. Once your expression matches something on the page, press CTRL+H.  The "Find" field should change from the expression you just typed to the literal value that was matched.  (This is unexpected behavior, IMHO, but isn't the worst part.)  Your focus should now be in the "Replace" box.
1. Tab or click back to the "Find" field.
1. CTRL+Z several times, then CTRL+Y several times, to move back and forth through your undo history.  You should see several characters erased, then replaced *with totally different characters* as matched literal text is "un-done" and regular expression control characters are "re-done".

## Expected behavior:

Ideally, CTRL+F / CTRL+H would only populate the "Find" box with the document selection when it's currently empty.  If you're going to insist on doing this, the undo/redo history should have one entry added at the end that consists of totally erasing the current contents and replacing them with the matched text, as though you had copied the text, selected the contents of the "Find" box, then pasted.

data.title: PHP use trait with namespace highlight break
[Feature] Have an extension to learn VSCode shortcuts the "FlashCard" way
data.body:
Using FlashCard is the best way I found to learn a lot of different things, especially with foreign languages where the vocabulary corpus learning task is one of the main time-consuming activity.
The same can be applied when learning VScode shortcuts. I would say that most of the developers stay with the one they know because they are reluctant to spend time learning new ones. ( @naure )
Having an extension that proposes at the beginning of every day to spend 5-10 minutes learning some shortcuts using a FlashCard system would I think lead to a progressive increase of productivity.
This extension could be then used to monitor the evolution of keyboard shortcut usage and provide insight on the time gained using those shortcuts.

@egamma, @dbaeumer WDYT?

data.title: TypeScript provides two identical tasks
data.body: Steps to reproduce: - create a fresh workspace - create a tsconfig.json ```ts { "compilerOptions": { "target": "es5", "module": "commonjs", "sourceMap": true, "outDir": "./bld", "rootDir": "./", "strict": true, "alwaysStrict": true, "moduleResolution": "node" } } ``` - create a test.ts file ```ts console.log("Hello World"); ``` - F1 > Run Task Observe: you have two tsc build tasks listed.

data.body:
I have seen people request the option (opt-in) to have the problems include the summary for all files. I was wondering if you could also add an option to restrict the PROBLEMS output and count in the status bar to only the currently edited file (not all opened ones).

I have several different scripts opened and would find it much cleaner to see errors for a single file. Many thanks for considering this!

data.title: Disable TypeScript watch support
data.body:
We should disable the TypeScript watch support again due to the following issues:

- the support adds a watch property to the task definition which results in the fact that is doesn't make existing task customizations anymore. The task engine needs to falsify these value when computing the identifier key. See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/31970. It basicallz broke the default build task support.
- the task engine currently writes the problem matcher into the tasks.json file however the matcher is now dynamic passed on `compileOnSave` from the tsconfig.json.
- the task provider should set the isBackground correctly and should use the correct problem matcher.

@mjbvz sorry for detecting this so late but I was on vacation until yesterday.

data.title: When computing the task definition key we should falsify undefined properties
data.body: This is necessary to ensure that old tasks.json files which contain a task customization still match new task provided with additional task definition properties.

data.title: ITaskSummary and events should carry the number of detected problems
data.body: See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30766 and the fixes and workarounds around it. This is especially necessary for watching tasks since they might miss errors since the marker stats are updates async.

data.title: [folding] show comment first line for folded sections

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I think it could be really useful to change the multiline comment folding.

When you fold a comment like this (like above php function) : 
/**
 * Print person name on terminal
 *
 * @param person $p
 * @return void
 */

You see this : 
/** ...

In some editors like phpStorm or Eclipse, it's folded like this : 
* Print person name on terminal ...

That's very more useful  ;)

Is it possible to implement this kind of folding ?

data.title: Terminal hides real exit code
data.body:
Steps:

- create a terminal using the internal API (e.g. like tasks does)
- register an onExit listener on the terminal instance
- execute a command in a terminal that returns an exit code !== 0 using the -c or /C option to exit the shell after the command has complete

Observe: the exit code passed to the listener is always 0. The underlying reason is that the exit code is the one of the node process we start to start the real terminal. And the node process always returns zero.

data.title: Setting default build task for Typescript does nothing at all.
data.body:
Following the steps in the VSCode documentation for Typescript here https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/typescript

The procedure for "Step 3: Make the Typescript build the default" doesn't work. The tasks.json file is generated in the project ./vscode directory and the contents are correct, but when pressing CTRL+SHIFT+B instead of running the default build task it instead continues to pop up the build selection dropdown instead.

So how do I actually configure the default build task?

data.title: Navigation/Cursor Position with High Surrogate Pairs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a file with a high surrogate pair character in it
2. Keyboard navigate and notice that there are _two_ positions for the cursor before the cursor moves, which affects copying and other positional items, including the `Col` number in the IDE

For example, this text will exhibit the problem:

```
|✔️|
```

Which contains the codepoint `U+2714`.

Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

data.title: Linting message about image URLs of extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows

Since v1.14, VS Code shows linting errors about image URLs for extensions.
https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_14#_extension-authoring

A message "Relative image URLs require a repository with HTTPS protocol in the package.json." with green is shown when the URL is relative even if that is not SVG, in `README.md` and `package.json`.

For example:

`package.json`

```js
"icon": "icon.png"
```

`README.md` (but message says "`package.json`")

```js
![screen-01](screen-01.gif)
```

Now, it seems that these images that are not SVG with relative URL are shown correctly.

I think that the linting message should not be shown.
Or, should we fix the URLs? (e.g. the `icon` in `package.json` should be `https://...`.)
(but `"icon": "images/icon.png"` is shown in https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/extension-manifest)
